Uses of Package
com.continuuity.loom.admin

Packages that use com.continuuity.loom.admin
com.continuuity.loom.admin Admin definable entities. 
com.continuuity.loom.cluster Cluster and Node objects. 
com.continuuity.loom.codec.json Codecs for serializing object to json and deserializing objects from json. 
com.continuuity.loom.layout Classes related to solving cluster layouts. 
com.continuuity.loom.scheduler Schedules threads for solving cluster layouts and planning and coordinating cluster jobs and tasks. 
com.continuuity.loom.scheduler.task Classes for coordinating tasks and jobs. 
com.continuuity.loom.store Persistent stores for admin definable entities, clusters, jobs, tasks, and nodes. 
 

Classes in com.continuuity.loom.admin used by com.continuuity.loom.admin
Administration
          Defines settings for cluster administration like lease duration, etc.
ClusterDefaults
          Default values for a cluster.
Compatibilities
          Defines hardwaretypes, imagetypes, and services that a cluster is compatible with.
Constraints
          Constraints for how a cluster can be laid out.
LayoutConstraint
          A Layout constraint specifies sets of services that must coexist on the same node, and sets of services that must not coexist on the same node in a cluster.
LeaseDuration
          Defines lease duration for a cluster.
NamedEntity
          A named entity has a name that must only consist of alphanumeric characters, underscore, period, and dash.
Provider.Type
          Types of providers.
ProvisionerAction
          Type of provisioner actions.
ServiceAction
          Actions that provisioners can execute on a service on a node.
ServiceConstraint
          Service constraints restrict what hardware and images are allowed for some service.
 

Classes in com.continuuity.loom.admin used by com.continuuity.loom.cluster
ClusterTemplate
          A cluster template defines different types of clusters that will be available for users to create.
NamedEntity
          A named entity has a name that must only consist of alphanumeric characters, underscore, period, and dash.
Provider
          Machine providers are instances of openstack, aws, rackspace, or joyent that can provision machines.
Service
          A service defines a set of services it is dependent on, as well as a mapping of ProvisionerAction to ServiceAction that provisioners will need to execute when performing cluster operations such as creation and deletion.
 

Classes in com.continuuity.loom.admin used by com.continuuity.loom.codec.json
Administration
          Defines settings for cluster administration like lease duration, etc.
ClusterDefaults
          Default values for a cluster.
ClusterTemplate
          A cluster template defines different types of clusters that will be available for users to create.
Compatibilities
          Defines hardwaretypes, imagetypes, and services that a cluster is compatible with.
Constraints
          Constraints for how a cluster can be laid out.
HardwareType
          A hardware type defines some hardware that will be used when constructing a cluster, as well as a mapping to different providers and information needed by the provisioner to create the hardware for each provider, which should contain the provider specific flavor and any other information needed to create the hardware.
ImageType
          Image type defines different images to use on on clusters, and include information needed by provisioners to provision machines from different providers.
LayoutConstraint
          A Layout constraint specifies sets of services that must coexist on the same node, and sets of services that must not coexist on the same node in a cluster.
LeaseDuration
          Defines lease duration for a cluster.
Provider
          Machine providers are instances of openstack, aws, rackspace, or joyent that can provision machines.
Service
          A service defines a set of services it is dependent on, as well as a mapping of ProvisionerAction to ServiceAction that provisioners will need to execute when performing cluster operations such as creation and deletion.
ServiceAction
          Actions that provisioners can execute on a service on a node.
ServiceConstraint
          Service constraints restrict what hardware and images are allowed for some service.
 

Classes in com.continuuity.loom.admin used by com.continuuity.loom.layout
ClusterTemplate
          A cluster template defines different types of clusters that will be available for users to create.
 

Classes in com.continuuity.loom.admin used by com.continuuity.loom.scheduler
ProvisionerAction
          Type of provisioner actions.

          Type of provisioner actions.

          A service defines a set of services it is dependent on, as well as a mapping of ProvisionerAction to ServiceAction that provisioners will need to execute when performing cluster operations such as creation and deletion.
